title: Why are Little Mix fans annoyed at Louis Walsh after Celebrity X Factor?
text:
This is a shout-out to my ex…judge (Pictures: Syco/WireImage)

Louis Walsh might be on the receiving end of Little Mix’s Black Magic if he’s not careful.

Comments made on The X Factor: Celebrity by the judge caused uproar from Little Mix fans online.

But what’s got the Little Mix fans so annoyed?

Here’s what you need to know.

What did Louis Walsh say about Little Mix?

Technically, nothing.

But a comment made about girl-band V5 performing on The X Factor: Celebrity was picked up as subtle shade.

V5 wowed judges with their performance, which prompted Louis to say that ‘the world needs a new girl group.’

But he didn’t stop there.

He also said ‘there are no current girl groups that can all sing.’ The first comment might’ve been innocent enough, the second… well, the fans had their say online.

This isn’t the only girl band drama Louis has had – he recently reignited a feud with former Girls Aloud and X Factor judge Cheryl.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Who are V5?

As well as being the girl group the world needs, apparently, V5 are a newly-formed group who came together for The X Factor: Celebrity.

Made up of social media influencers Sofia Oliveria, Alondra Martinez, Laura Buitrago, Natalie Valerin and Wendii, the group has a combined social media following of 11 million, and over 250 million channel views on YouTube.

The power of (v)5 (Picture: ITV)

They aren’t taking their shot at musical stardom lightly, though.

Group member Wendii has said she ‘always had a passion for music ever since [she] was a little girl.’

She ‘started taking it more seriously at the age of 11 when [she] did [her] first stage performance at a show called ‘La Voz Kids’ from there on out [she] knew for sure [she] wanted to be an artist.’

Who went through to the live shows on X Factor Celebrity?

Could V5 be the next Little Mix, like Louis seems to think?

Well, they’re one step closer as they made it through to the live rounds of the competition.

Who'll be competing on the X Factor: Celebrity live shows? Simon’s groups: V5 The Islanders – made up of Love Island stars Wes Nelson, Samira Mighty, Eyal Booker and Zara McDermott. Try Star – sports stars Thom Evans, Ben Foden and Levi Davis. Max and Harvey – influencers who shot to fame on the app musical.ly. Louis’ Unders (under the age of 28) Olivia Olson – best known for singing All I Want for Christmas on Love, Actually. Jonny Labey – former EastEnders star. Megan McKenna – former reality star who has released an album in the past. Kevin McHale – former Glee star. Nicole’s Overs (over the age of 28) Martin Bashir – a former journalist who had an interview with Princess Diana that caused ripples worldwide. Ricki Lake – actress and talk-show host. Victoria Ekanoye – former Coronation Street Star. Vinnie Jones – the former football bad boy sadly missed out on auditions after losing his wife, but will be appearing on the first live show.

The X Factor: Celebrity continues on ITV next Saturday night at 8.20pm.

description: Little Mix fans took to Twitter to bash Louis Walsh after The X Factor: Celebrity this week. What did he say about the girl band?
